page.title: 19Farms
page.content: There are quite a few farms in our area and they vary from arable farming to pigs,cattle.We at school are very friendly with the local farmers and often visit their farms in connection with work we are doing in school.Some of our farms have quite a history,for example it is said that Charles 1st slept at Manor Hall Farm and there is a seventeenth century grave stone their.Alan Wright,who owns Allandale farm (a pig farm) is a great friend of the school,his children come here and he is very much involved with the life and work of the community.While we have been doing the Domesday project all the local farmers have welcomed us on to their land.Our school playground looks out over the neighbouring countryside and we can see the various fields and for what they are being used.
